query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Così discesi del cerchio primaio 2 giù nel secondo, che men loco cinghia 3 e tanto più dolor, che punge a guaio.
query.error: **English:** 1 Thus I descended from the first circle 2 down into the second, which girds a smaller space 3 and so much more pain, that it stings to lament.
query.result: 1 Evam aham avaruhya prathamam cakram 2 Adhaḥ dvitīye, yaḥ alpa deśam āveṣṭayati 3 Evaṃ ca atirikta duḥkham, yat pipīlikāyate kraন্দने.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 Stavvi Minòs orribilmente, e ringhia: 5 essamina le colpe ne l’intrata; 6 giudica e manda secondo ch’avvinghia.
query.error: **English:** 4 There Minos stands ferociously and snarls, 5 he examines the sins at the entrance, 6 he judges and sends [the sinners] according to how he entwines himself.
query.result: 4 Tatrāsti Mīnoḥ ghoraḥ kṣobhaṇaḥ, 5 praviṣṭeṣu pāpāni parīkṣate, 6 yathāvalingayati tathā vinirṇāya prayacchati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 Dico che quando l’anima mal nata 8 li vien dinanzi, tutta si confessa; 9 e quel conoscitor de le peccata

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 vede qual loco d’inferno è da essa; 11 cignesi con la coda tante volte 12 quantunque gradi vuol che giù sia messa.
query.error: **English:** 10 sees what place in hell is due to it; 11 he lashes it with his tail as many times 12 as the degrees he wants it to be cast down.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Sempre dinanzi a lui ne stanno molte: 14 vanno a vicenda ciascuna al giudizio, 15 dicono e odono e poi son giù volte.
query.error: **English:** 13 Many always stand before him: 14 each one goes in turn to the judgment, 15 they speak and listen and then are cast down.
query.result: 13 Nityam tasya purastāt tiṣṭhanti bahvyaḥ: 14 Yānti pratyekam niyamena niścayāya, 15 Bruvanti śṛṇvanti ca tataḥ adhastāt patanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Non impedir lo suo fatale andare: 23 vuolsi così colà dove si puote 24 ciò che si vuole, e più non dimandare».
query.error: **English:** 22 Do not hinder his fated journey: 23 it is desired thus there where one can 24 do what one wills, and ask no more."
query.result: 22 Mā pratibandha tasya niyatam gamanam: 23 Iccha eva tatra yatra śakyate 24 Yat kiṃcid icchati, na ca punaḥ prcchasi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Or incomincian le dolenti note 26 a farmisi sentire; or son venuto 27 là dove molto pianto mi percuote.
query.error: **English:** 25 Now the sorrowful notes begin 26 to make themselves heard; now I have come 27 where much lamentation strikes me.
query.result: 25 Atha duḥkhāḥ śabdāḥ ārabhante 26 mama śravaṇe patitum; atha aham āgataḥ asmi 27 tatra yatra bahuḥ śokaḥ āhatyate mama.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Io venni in loco d’ogne luce muto, 29 che mugghia come fa mar per tempesta, 30 se da contrari venti è combattuto.
query.error: **English:** 28 I came to a place devoid of all light, 29 which roars like the sea in a storm, 30 when it is battered by opposing winds.
query.result: 28 Ahaṃ prāpaṃ sthānaṃ sarva-prakāśa-rahitaṃ, 29 Yat tuṣṇīṃbhavati yathā samudraḥ prabala-vāyu-saṃyuge, 30 Yatra viparīta-vātavaśāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 La bufera infernal, che mai non resta, 32 mena li spirti con la sua rapina; 33 voltando e percotendo li molesta.
query.error: **English:** 31 The infernal tempest, which never rests, 32 drives the spirits with its violence; 33 turning and striking, it torments them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Quando giungon davanti a la ruina, 35 quivi le strida, il compianto, il lamento; 36 bestemmian quivi la virtù divina.
query.error: **English:** 34 When they arrive before the ruin, 35 there are shrieks, and lamentations, and wails; 36 there they blaspheme the divine power.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Intesi ch’a così fatto tormento 38 enno dannati i peccator carnali, 39 che la ragion sommettono al talento.
query.error: **English:** 37 I heard that to such torment 38 are condemned the carnal sinners, 39 who subject reason to desire.
query.result: 37 Aśrauṣam yathā tādṛśe kleśe 38 Adhunā dāruṇe dāruṇe narakapātakino niyamyante, 39 Ye kāmam eva hetum manyante.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.result: 40 Eva ca yathā śārṅgāḥ pakṣau bibhrati 41 śīta-kāle, viśāla-pūrṇa-gaṇe, 42 evam vātaḥ praṇayati pāpātmanaḥ

query.prompt:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 A vizio di lussuria fu sì rotta, 56 che libito fé licito in sua legge, 57 per tòrre il biasmo in che era condotta.
query.error: **English:** 55 By a vision of lust she was so overcome, 56 that she made desire licit in her law, 57 to remove the blame in which she was held.
query.result: 55 Kāmadrṣṭyā tasyāḥ saṃjātaḥ parābhavaḥ, 56 yathā svadharmeṇa kāmaḥ kṛtaḥ syāt, 57 yena nindā yasyāḥ āsīt, sā nivāryeta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Ell’ è Semiramìs, di cui si legge 59 che succedette a Nino e fu sua sposa: 60 tenne la terra che ’l Soldan corregge.
query.error: **English:** 58 She is Semiramis, of whom one reads 59 that she succeeded Ninus and was his wife: 60 she held the land that the Sultan rules.
query.result: 58 Sā Semiramī nāma, yāṃ śrūyate 59 Ninum anvanīyāpatnī tasya ca bhūtā: 60 Yāṃ bhūmiṃ Soldāno niyamati, sāṃ tām adhiṣṭhātum īśate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.error: **English:** 61 The other is she who killed herself for love, 62 and broke faith with the ashes of Sychaeus; 63 then there is lustful Cleopatra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Elena vedi, per cui tanto reo 65 tempo si volse, e vedi ’l grande Achille, 66 che con amore al fine combatteo.

67 Vedi Parìs, Tristano»; e più di mille 68 ombre mostrommi e nominommi a dito, 69 ch’amor di nostra vita dipartille.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Poscia ch’io ebbi ’l mio dottore udito 71 nomar le donne antiche e ’ cavalieri, 72 pietà mi giunse, e fui quasi smarrito.
query.error: **English:** 70 After I had heard my teacher 71 name the ancient ladies and knights, 72 pity overcame me, and I was almost bewildered.
query.result: 70 Tataḥ aham śrutvā mama upādhyāyam 71 nāmadheyāni prācīnānāṃ strīṇāṃ ca vīrāṇāṃ ca, 72 dayā mayi jāta, aham ca prāyaḥ mūḍhaḥ abhūvam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 I’ cominciai: «Poeta, volontieri 74 parlerei a quei due che ’nsieme vanno, 75 e paion sì al vento esser leggeri».

query.result: 73 Ahamarabham: "Kavi, priyatamaḥ, 74 tadubhayorapi puruṣayorapi samīpavartinorapi, 75 ye ca vāyau tathā laghutvāt sthitau iva."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Ed elli a me: «Vedrai quando saranno 77 più presso a noi; e tu allor li priega 78 per quello amor che i mena, ed ei verranno».
query.error: **English:** 76 And they to me: "You will see when they are 77 nearer to us; and then you may beg them 78 by that love which leads them, and they will come."
query.result: 76 Eva ca tau mayā saha: "Draṣṭā tvam, yadā 77 Avaraḥ santi asmāt; tataḥ tvam prārthayasetau 78 Tena premeṇa yena te nayati, tataśca tau āgacchatām."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Sì tosto come il vento a noi li piega, 80 mossi la voce: «O anime affannate, 81 venite a noi parlar, s’altri nol niega!».
query.error: **English:** 79 As soon as the wind bends our feet towards them, 80 they raised their voices: "O weary souls, 81 come and speak to us, if no one else forbids it!"
query.result: 79 Yathāśīghram vāyur asmākam pādayoḥ praṇāmayati, 80 tāḥ svayam ātmānaḥ śabdam cakruḥ: "He duḥkhitātmānaḥ, 81 āgacchata asmābhiḥ saha samvādam kartum, yadi anyaḥ etad na pratiṣedhati!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Quali colombe dal disio chiamate 83 con l’ali alzate e ferme al dolce nido 84 vegnon per l’aere, dal voler portate;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 se fosse amico il re de l’universo, 92 noi pregheremmo lui de la tua pace, 93 poi c’hai pietà del nostro mal perverso.
query.error: **English:** 91 if the king of the universe were our friend, 92 we would pray to him for your peace, 93 since you have pity on our perverse evil.
query.result: 91 Yadi jagannāthaḥ asmābhiḥ suhṛd abhaviṣyat, 92 Tava śāntiṃ tasya yācemahi, 93 Yataḥ asmākam duritātmakaṃ pāpaṃ prati tava dayā asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Di quel che udire e che parlar vi piace, 95 noi udiremo e parleremo a voi, 96 mentre che ’l vento, come fa, ci tace.
query.error: **English:** 94 Of that which you like to hear and speak, 95 we will hear and speak to you, 96 while the wind, as it does, is silent for us.
query.result: 94 Yat śrotum priyam ca vaktum ca vām, 95 tat śroṣyāmaḥ kathayāmaś ca vām, 96 yāvad vātaḥ, yathā karoti, naḥ śamayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Siede la terra dove nata fui 98 su la marina dove ’l Po discende 99 per aver pace co’ seguaci sui.
query.error: **English:** 97 The land where I was born is situated 98 on the seashore where the Po River descends 99 to find peace with its followers.
query.result: 97 Sa bhūmiḥ yatra aham jātaḥ āsam 98 samudratīre yatra Paḥ nadī avatiṣṭate 99 sva-anugāmibhiḥ saha śāntim prāptum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Amor, ch’al cor gentil ratto s’apprende, 101 prese costui de la bella persona 102 che mi fu tolta; e ’l modo ancor m’offende.
query.error: **English:** 100 Love, which is quickly learned by a gentle heart, 101 seized this man because of his beautiful form, 102 which was taken from me; and the manner still offends me.
query.result: 100 Kāmaḥ, yaḥ hṛdi śīghram gṛhyate, 101 enam gṛhītavān asya sundara-rūpatvāt, 102 yaḥ mayā haritaḥ; tatraiva prakāraḥ adyāpi māṁ pidayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Amor, ch’a nullo amato amar perdona, 104 mi prese del costui piacer sì forte, 105 che, come vedi, ancor non m’abbandona.
query.error: **English:** 103 Love, which to no beloved spares the loved one, 104 seized me with such desire for this one's beauty 105 that, as you see, it still does not abandon me.
query.result: 103 Kāmaḥ, yaḥ na kaścid api priyaḥ priyam muñcati, 104 mama hṛdayam asyaiḥ saundaryaiḥ evam adhipatyam cakāra, 105 yathā, yathā tvam paśyasi, ayam mama tyāgam na karoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Amor condusse noi ad una morte. 107 Caina attende chi a vita ci spense». 108 Queste parole da lor ci fuor porte.
query.error: **English:** 106 Love led us to one death. 107 Cain awaits him who quenched our life." 108 These words were uttered by them to us.
query.result: 106 Premaṇā nau mṛtyuṃ prāpayām āsa. 107 Kāinā pratikṣate yam āyur apāharat. 108 Imāni vacāṃsi taiḥ asmābhiḥ śrutāni.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Quand’ io intesi quell’ anime offense, 110 china’ il viso, e tanto il tenni basso, 111 fin che ’l poeta mi disse: «Che pense?».
query.error: **English:** 109 When I heard those souls offended, 110 I lowered my face, and kept it down so long, 111 until the poet said to me: "What are you thinking?".
query.result: 109 Yada aham ātmānaṃ śṛṇomi apakarṣitam, 110 Tadā vaktram avahanāmi, tathā ca dīrgham kālam karoti sma, 111 Yāvat kaviḥ mama abravīt: "Kim cintayasi?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Quando rispuosi, cominciai: «Oh lasso, 113 quanti dolci pensier, quanto disio 114 menò costoro al doloroso passo!».
query.error: **English:** 112 When you replied, I began: "Oh, alas, 113 how many sweet thoughts, how much desire 114 led these people to the sorrowful pass!"
query.result: 112 Yada tvam pratyavādeḥ, aham ārabhe: "Aha duḥkhitaḥ, 113 kīyantīni madhurāṇi cintāni, kīyān niścayaḥ 114 imān lokān duḥkhamayam mārgaṃ nayati!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Poi mi rivolsi a loro e parla’ io, 116 e cominciai: «Francesca, i tuoi martìri 117 a lagrimar mi fanno tristo e pio.
query.error: **English:** 115 Then I turned to them and I spoke, 116 and I began: "Francesca, your torments 117 make me sad and compassionate to tears.
query.result: 115 Tataḥ aham teṣāṃ prati apavartām āhaṃ ca uvāca, 116 ārabhya ca: "Francesca, tava martyāḥ 117 aśrubhiḥ śokam āvahanti mama ca dayām."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Ma dimmi: al tempo d’i dolci sospiri, 119 a che e come concedette amore 120 che conosceste i dubbiosi disiri?».
query.error: **English:** 118 But tell me: at the time of sweet sighs, 119 how and why did love grant 120 that you should know the uncertain desires?
query.result: 118 Api tu mama bruhi: kāle madhura-niḥśvāsanānām, 119 katham ca kena vā anumataḥ kāmaḥ 120 yathā tvaṃ jānīṣe saṃdeha-vāñchāḥ?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 E quella a me: «Nessun maggior dolore 122 che ricordarsi del tempo felice 123 nella miseria; e ciò sa ’l tuo dottore.
query.error: **English:** 121 And she to me: "There is no greater sorrow 122 than to recall a happy time 123 in misery; and this your teacher knows well.
query.result: 121 Tathā ca sā mama: "Na kaścid atiricyate śokaḥ 122 yadi sukhasya smaraṇam bhavati 123 duḥkhe; etad eva tava ācāryaḥ jānāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Ma s’a conoscer la prima radice 125 del nostro amor tu hai cotanto affetto, 126 dirò come colui che piange e dice.
query.error: **English:** 124 But if you have such a desire to know the first root 125 of our love, 126 I will tell you as one who weeps and speaks.
query.result: 124 Api tu prathamamūlaṃ jñātumasmākaṃ premaṇaḥ 125 Yat te tāvadabhilāṣaḥ, 126 Vyakṣyāmi yathā rudan uktavān aham.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Noi leggiavamo un giorno per diletto 128 di Lancialotto come amor lo strinse; 129 soli eravamo e sanza alcun sospetto.
query.error: **English:** 127 One day, for our pleasure, we were reading 128 about Lancelot, how love constrained him; 129 we were alone, and without any suspicion.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Per più fïate li occhi ci sospinse 131 quella lettura, e scolorocci il viso; 132 ma solo un punto fu quel che ci vinse.
query.error: **English:** 130 Many times that reading urged our eyes 131 and drained the color from our faces, 132 but it was only one point that overcame us.
query.result: 130 Punaḥ punaḥ naur ekayā vācayā 131 Anavadhāritavān asmākam cakṣuṣī, 132 Tathāpi eka eva viṣayaḥ āsīt yaḥ asmān abhibhavitavān.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 Quando leggemmo il disïato riso 134 esser basciato da cotanto amante, 135 questi, che mai da me non fia diviso,

query.result: 133 Yada vayam paṭhāmaḥ kāmayamānaḥ hasaḥ 134 cumbitaḥ āsīt tathāvidhena priyatamena, 135 ayam, yaḥ kadācit mama na viyujyate,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 la bocca mi basciò tutto tremante. 137 Galeotto fu ’l libro e chi lo scrisse: 138 quel giorno più non vi leggemmo avante».
query.error: **English:** 136 kissed my mouth, trembling all over. 137 The book and its author were a Galeotto: 138 that day we read no further.
query.result: 136 mama mukham acumbat sarvaḥ kampamānaḥ. 137 Galeotto fu ’l libro e chi lo scrisse: 138 quel giorno più non vi leggemmo avante».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Mentre che l’uno spirto questo disse, 140 l’altro piangëa; sì che di pietade 141 io venni men così com’ io morisse.
query.error: **English:** 139 While one spirit said this, 140 the other wept; so that out of pity 141 I fainted, as if I were dying.
query.result: 139 Mentre che l’uno spirto questo disse, 140 l’altro piangëa; sì che di pietade 141 io venni men così com’ io morisse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 E caddi come corpo morto cade.
query.error: **English:** 142 And I fell as a dead body falls.
query.result: 142 Tataśca mṛtavatvapātī babhūva.
